item.title: 众议院能源和商业委员会已启动了一项针对美国器官移植系统的两党调查，这是继参议院和举报人指控美国器官移植系统失灵和管理不善的报告之后，对该系统进行的最新一次审查。
item.description:
The House Committee on Energy and Commerce has launched a bipartisan investigation into the U.S. organ transplant system — the latest scrutiny of the system following reports from the Senate and whistleblowers alleging its failures and mismanagement. https://t.co/KwqyFMgXAt

— ABC News (@ABC) March 22, 2024

item.title: 前总统特朗普民事欺诈案的法官已任命一名监督员来监督特朗普组织的财务状况。
item.description:
The judge in former Pres. Trump's civil fraud trial has imposed a monitor to oversee the Trump Organization's finances. https://t.co/N5TEBwy6Ma

— ABC News (@ABC) March 22, 2024

item.title: 据白宫称，最新的学生债务免除将使白宫政府为近 400 万美国人免除的债务总额达到约 1,440 亿美元。
item.description:
The latest student debt cancellations will bring his administration's total forgiveness to about $144 billion for nearly 4 million Americans, according to the White House. https://t.co/319MySMQyv

— ABC News (@ABC) March 22, 2024

item.title: 为配合世界水日而发布的《2024 年联合国世界水资源开发报告》指出，清洁、安全的水资源是我们这个世界的 "重要纽带"，对促进和平至关重要：
item.description:
Access to clean and safe water is the "great connector" of our world and critical in promoting peace, according to the 2024 U.N. World Water Development Report released to coincide with World Water Day.

Learn more: https://t.co/qpo6JbYGaz pic.twitter.com/hSaP8NHYlI

— ABC News (@ABC) March 22, 2024

item.title: 田纳西州州长比尔-李（Bill Lee）周四签署了一项立法，旨在保护词曲作者、表演者和其他音乐行业专业人士免受人工智能的潜在危险，并向该州最具代表性的居民之一致敬。
item.description:
In a nod to one of the state's most iconic residents, Tennessee Gov. Bill Lee on Thursday signed off on legislation designed to protect songwriters, performers and other music industry professionals against the potential dangers of artificial intelligence. https://t.co/wU1WhARc90 pic.twitter.com/1JhTUDTkeK

— ABC News (@ABC) March 22, 2024

item.title: 阿拉巴马州州长凯-艾维（Kay Ivey）签署了一项大刀阔斧的法案，禁止将州政府资金用于州政府机构、高等教育机构和其他公共实体的 DEI 计划和办公室。
item.description:
Alabama Gov. Kay Ivey has signed a sweeping bill that prohibits the use of state funds for DEI programs and offices at state agencies, higher education institutions and other public entities. https://t.co/vGZSqti9Em

— ABC News (@ABC) March 22, 2024

item.title: 俄克拉荷马州塔尔萨县地方检察官周四表示，不会对俄克拉荷马州少年奈克斯-本尼迪克特（Nex Benedict）在死前一天卷入的斗殴事件提出指控：
item.description:
No charges will be filed in connection with a fight that Oklahoma teen Nex Benedict was involved in a day before they died, the Tulsa County district attorney said Thursday.

item.title: 新文件显示，特朗普在与拜登的竞争中面临重大经济劣势，因为法律账单蚕食了盟友的现金。
item.description: Trump faces major financial disadvantage against Biden as legal bills eat into allies' cash, new filings show. https://t.co/BETPRdNQKY

item.title: 据当局称，两名少年在被送往佐治亚州奥古斯塔的一家青少年拘留中心时从警方手中逃脱，据称他们在周四打晕了一名副警长，之后又被重新关押。
item.description:
Two juveniles who escaped from police while being transported to a youth detention center in Augusta, Georgia, are back in custody after allegedly knocking out a deputy on Thursday, authorities say. https://t.co/It4BmwxuuK

item.title: 美国疾病预防控制中心的数据显示，在过去二十年里，美国因吸毒过量死亡的人数几乎每年都在上升，并不断刷新年度记录，成为美国历史上最严重的吸毒过量流行病。
item.description:
Over the last two decades, the number of U.S. overdose deaths has risen almost every year and continued to break annual records — making it the worst overdose epidemic in American history, CDC figures show. https://t.co/Sq2arz614q

— ABC News (@ABC) March 22, 2024

item.title: 根据教科文组织的报告，约有 22 亿人无法获得安全管理的饮用水，35 亿人无法获得安全管理的卫生设施。
item.description:
About 2.2 billion people live without access to safely managed drinking water and 3.5 billion people lack access to safely managed sanitation, according to UNESCO report. https://t.co/m64hlWAQKB

— ABC News (@ABC) March 22, 2024

item.title: 内布拉斯加州的护士收养了她们在新生儿重症监护室照顾过的女婴："如果这是你的心愿，我会说去做吧，不要逃避，因为有[很多]孩子需要收养"。
item.description:
Nebraska nurses adopt baby girl they cared for in the NICU: "If it's something that's on your heart, I would say go for it and don't steer away, because there are [many] kids that need adoption." https://t.co/sKs9mfm1rD

— ABC News (@ABC) March 22, 2024

item.title: 拜登政府周四起诉苹果公司，指控这家科技巨头阻止竞争对手使用 iPhone 的硬件和软件功能，从而在智能手机市场形成垄断。
item.description:
The Biden administration sued Apple on Thursday, alleging the tech giant created a monopoly in the smartphone market by blocking competitors from accessing hardware and software features of the iPhone. https://t.co/pTHhbjcoFO

item.title: 一位母亲的四胞胎新生儿重症监护病房住院账单总额超过 400 万美元，引发了关于美国医疗费用高昂的讨论。

item.title: 在纽约布鲁克林区，一名乘客在一列火车驶来时失去知觉，从站台上跌落，思维敏捷的纽约警察跳入诺斯特兰大道站的地铁轨道，对其施以援手。
item.description:
Quick-thinking NYPD officers jumped into the Nostrand Avenue station subway tracks in Brooklyn, New York, to come to the aid of a straphanger who lost consciousness and fell from the platform as a train was coming. https://t.co/R07v5Qekbs pic.twitter.com/sgP50P7jmy

item.title: 拜登总统周四宣布，他的政府将免除约 78,000 名公共服务人员 58 亿美元的联邦学生贷款债务。@SelinaWangTV 从华盛顿特区为您带来更多精彩内容#RightHereRightNow.

— ABC News Live (@ABCNewsLive) March 21, 2024

item.title: 法国体育部长表示，2023 年，300 多名法国教练、教师和体育官员被指控性虐待或掩盖此类不法行为。

More than 300 French coaches, teachers and sports officials have been accused of sexual abuse or of covering up such wrongdoing in 2023, the country's sports minister said. https://t.co/ZlYKRpmodc

— ABC News (@ABC) March 21, 2024

item.title: 新泽西州参议员鲍勃-梅嫩德斯（Bob Menendez）表示，由于面临腐败和其他指控，他将不再寻求连任民主党参议员。尽管如此，他仍表示有可能在 11 月以独立候选人身份参选。
item.description:
BREAKING: New Jersey Sen. Bob Menendez says he will not seek another term as a Democrat as he faces corruption and other charges, which he denies. Still, he left the possibility of running in November open as an independent. https://t.co/ouaJq98YpQ

— ABC News (@ABC) March 21, 2024

item.title: 几十年来，汽车已经变得越来越安全，但仍有许多工作要做，而女性碰撞假人的开发可能会确保美国妇女的更大安全。
item.description:
Cars have gotten safer over the decades, but more still needs to be done — and the development of female crash dummies may ensure greater safety of women in the U.S. https://t.co/pS75q1t1Io

— ABC News (@ABC) March 21, 2024

item.title: 警方消息来源告诉美国广播公司新闻（ABC News），两名寮屋居民因涉嫌谋杀而被通缉，因为他们涉嫌杀害了一名撞见他们住在其母亲纽约公寓的妇女。
item.description:

item.title: 一项新的分析显示，目前在美国买房要比租房贵得多，预计至少在未来五年内，房地产市场都将如此。

item.title: 预计众议院将于周五就两党达成的政府拨款方案进行投票，国会将在最后期限前努力避免政府部分停摆。
